case_vignette: A 22-year-old man comes to the physician because of a progressive swelling and pain in his right ring finger for the past 2 days. The pain began while playing football, when his finger got caught in the jersey of another player who forcefully pulled away. Examination shows that the right ring finger is extended. There is pain and swelling at the distal interphalangeal joint. When the patient is asked to make a fist, his right ring finger does not flex at the distal interphalangeal joint. There is no joint laxity.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
correct_ans: rupture of the flexor digitorum profundus tendon at its point of insertion

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have swelling and pain in my right ring finger, which has been getting worse over the past 2 days.
Do you have any history of arthritis or joint pain?
No, I don't have any history of arthritis or joint pain.
Do you have a history of any recent injury or trauma to your right ring finger?

Do you have any other symptoms or medical conditions that you think might be relevant?
No, I don't have any other symptoms or medical conditions that are relevant.
Do you take any medications or have any allergies?
The case vignette I am based on doesn't provide that information.
Understood. Is there any family history of joint problems or autoimmune conditions?
The case vignette I am based on doesn't mention any family history of joint problems or autoimmune conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Acute traumatic injury resulting in right ring finger sprain or fracture

My right ring finger has been swelling and hurting for the past 2 days.
Have you experienced this type of swelling and pain in your finger before?
No, this is the first time this has happened.

The vignette does not provide any information about that.
I see. Is there a history of arthritis or other joint conditions in your family?

I understand. How old are you and what is your sex?

Thank you. Based on your symptoms and medical history, it is possible that you are experiencing an acute case of gout. Gout is a type of arthritis that occurs when too much uric acid builds up in the body and forms crystals in the joints, leading to sudden and severe pain, swelling, and warmth in the affected joint. However, further investigation is needed to confirm the diagnosis. I recommend seeking medical attention for a proper evaluation and diagnosis.
